Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: jerome347
Reviews.Content: I spend there one night because of a late flight, I was supposed to go directly to Olympia when landing, but it was the night already. They had a room for me, and it was a really good night before going to my meeting the day after. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2112
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here but felt it was excellent value and the reception staff were great. They let us leave our bags for a day in the staff room while we visited Seattle. Rooms were clean, water extremely hot and we had a nice room next to a little garden. It was close enough to walk from the airport but we didn't know the way so we took a taxi for less than $10 including tip. As another reviewer mentioned, there is a very nice Denny's nearby (ask at reception for 20% discount coupon). Actually Denny's is about halfway to the airport so when we were leaving we walked about 10 minutes to Dennys for dinner, then about another 10 minutes to the airport. The hotel is midway between two train stops, around 15 minutes walk to Tukwila station from which you can take a very pleasant train ride into the city centre. If we were in Seattle again I'd probably look for another place even closer to the airport as there seems to be plenty of options and the airport is also a train line terminal, so easy to go to the city. But if you have a car, this hotel would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but too out of town.”
Reviews.Author: Kateofthedead
Reviews.Content: My Sister & I travelled America for a month and really needed to save some cash on hotels for petrol & food, so out of the 18 places we visited we stayed at 13 Motel 6's. Firstly, the hotel is so easy to find - we did most of our trip using simple Google map directions and the location of this Motel 6 is ideal. The hotel is located 3 minutes from Seattle TAC Airport, we arrived at 8pm after a long 14 hour journey (one stop off) from London Heathrow, so we were tired and suffering with the 8 hour time difference. The hotel on arrival was average, a large car park and a motel looking exterior - whilst checking in I found the receptionist on the desk to be a little rude but being so exhausted and American/English service being different - I would only put this down to cultural difference rather than actual rudeness. The room itself is very basic but clean, do not expect any cooking facilities or a kettle. Motel 6 is very basic, coffee is served until 10:30am from reception but that is it. They're vending machines and the such in the motel service room with a can of coke being roughly $1. Our bathroom was a little dirty, a floor mat was hung over the bathroom door which appeared to be dripping a brown substance from it - which was still damp. Having stayed in so many Motel 6's in the last month whilst travelling America, almost all Motel 6's are the same and Seattle wasn't at all different from many of the places we stayed however the Motel itself could do with a little updating, yet if you're on a cheap budget and only plan to sleep in the room whilst visiting - I recommend this hotel. It's location to the airport is ideal but you must have a hire vehicle if you plan on visiting downtown or anywhere other than the small sparce strip the Motel is located on. Also, I'd advise you to not park anywhere near the hotel entrance or exits - our hire vehicle was hit from behind during a hit and run incident during the evening, although the reception area is manned 24 hours and most Motel 6's have security on site, our vehicle was parked by a very large floor to roof window in front of the reception area yet police were not informed until the morning hours when my Sister & I actually saw the damage and shunted vehicle. I gather reception staff will not take any responsibility for accidents or incidents and inform the police although reports of the accident were told to the staff from other hotel guests and the incident itself was apparently extremely loud. CCTV does not watch the carpark, only the office.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Cleanest Rooms In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: B00GY101
Reviews.Content: Originally I came to seattle on business and stayed at the La Hacienda because of location.Their rooms where 70 a night which was okay but all the rooms havent been remodeled and we stayed in one that smelled of cig smoke really bad. So bad that it stained every article of clothing in my suitcase. I am a smoker and it really bothered me. Decided to try another hotel a wee bit further out in hopes of better conditions so I decided to try this place out. I was very skeptical considering they only charged 50 BUCKS for 2 people. I Paid for only 1 night at first to see how it was. Wow.....was i impressed. While this is a no frills hotel, all rooms have been remodeled tastfully and where REALLY CLEAN.I actually tried to find dirt and found none. It was very quiet(at least on the back side-upperfloor), and I felt totally safe. The staff where cordial enough and tended to my needs.If you are on a budget or if you just want a CLEAN and quiet place for a few nights, this is the place. I HEARD NO AIRPLANES! W00T :) Beds are new also. Pillows kick butt

Reviews.Title: “cheap, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: whomever
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night to have access to the airport- was a short drive to return the rental car. everything was fine- clean room, quiet (i had requested a quiet upstairs room in the rear not facing traffic), easy check-in. the interior halls can be noisy but it wasn't problem with my stay. they advertise expanded cable but there were only the usual 20 channels. overall, it was a typical motel6 and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and quick stay”
Reviews.Author: sodakjc
Reviews.Content: The motel was very affordable for the area. It is close to the airport and not too far from the tram (about six blocks) to access downtown. The room was clean and nice for the price. It is in accordance with what one would expect from a Motel 6 .....reasonable prices, few frills, but solid quality. We followed the advice from the desk clerk and stayed in a room towards the back of the motel. Our room was quiet, peaceful and worth the price. It had an "old motel" room smell, but a few squirts of air freshner took care of that. The extra 3 dollars for the internet was worth it, as it worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Met My Expectations of for a $45 a night motel.”
Reviews.Author: cjsmith45
Reviews.Content: We drove from Portland to Seattle for an afternoon Mariners game and had decided to stay one night to 'explore' Seattle. This location was a bit south of everything, but I knew that when I made the reservations. I'd read the reviews on this location, so was a bit leery. At checkin, the clerk suggested a room in the back which she said was quieter. The view was kind of park-like, and there was a picnic table below (next to the garbage enclosed garbage cans). The room was within my expectations, very clean and adequate for the price. There was a bit of an 'old room' smell, but a couple of spritz's of my room spray took that away. We did turn the fan on for a bit of 'grey' noise overnight (again had to use my room spray). My bed was very comfortable, which was nice! Basically if you're expecting the luxury of a $100+ a night motel, dont stay here.. But if you just want a cheap place to spend the night and you do stay here, ask for a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “go there only if you need to fly out of seattle in the early morning!”
Reviews.Author: geppe1970
Reviews.Content: the most awful motel 6 ever! the room smelled badly and looked dirty. The only plus is that it's close to SEA and cheap. go there only if you need to fly out of seattle in the early morning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: EugenePullman
Reviews.Content: My brother and his children arrived at SeaTac and we stayed here two nights after their arrival and again one night before their departure. The AAA rating was unfair. I was apprehensive about staying here at a AAA-rated one-star hotel so I checked out the reviews at 'TripAdvisor.com'. I would say that the good reviews were right and the bad reviews were wrong. There is no bar nearby here as someone suggested. Since several reviews indicated noise problems, we asked for the quietest rooms. Both times they gave us rooms with numbers in the 140's. They were perfectly quiet. I didn't see evidence of partying types staying here, but you might have noise if you get the wrong neighbor. Those rooms were in a place where we had to walk about 20 yards to carry our luggage in, with no parking right in front. The rooms were clean and everything worked properly. Could have used a second chair. Excellent location for SeaTac. Check at the desk for directions to the airport so you make the correct turn; it is not marked on the highway. If you make the right turn, it is a 5 minute drive and then we spent about 10 minutes in plugged traffic at the airport, coming and going. They had no shuttle but we had a car. We had a 25 minute drive to a parking garage in downtown Seattle for sight-seeing. The staff was helpful with all our needs. No major complaints. This will be my first choice if I have to pick up someone in Seattle again. I just need a place where I can sleep and don't care about all the fancy stuff. We paid $3 per night for wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value”
Reviews.Author: Wordtech
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this site and was hestitant to stay here. But I needed something cheap in that area and Motel 6 fit the bill. Also, I had stayed not long before at the Motel 6 at DFW airport and loved the value. I was not disappointed with the SEA airport Motel 6. Was it recently renovated? I don't know, but it was very clean. The staff at the desk were friendly and helpful. The room was very basic but perfect for my needs. I paid UIS$40. What value! It's now definitely my first choice in Seattle. The area is a bit sterile. Walk three short blocks south on the same side of the street to a very nice Denny's. There's no airport shuttle service, but just cross the street from the motel at the light and get the 174, which takes you to the terminal door. It's probably faster than waiting for a cab! GETTING THERE. I arrived in Seattle at the Greyhound Bus Depot downtown. Walk out the front door onto Stewart Street and look diagonally across the street to the left. You'll see the court house with a plaza in front. Head to the bus stop and take the 394 express. Take it all the way south to the airport and transfer to the 174 heading north, back to downtown Seattle. Yes, you're going in the direction from which you just came, but get this: The bus leaves you off right at the Motel 6 lobby! It's just a short ride from the airport; look for the huge Motel 6 sign in the air and ring the buzzer. If you have luggage, it couldn't be easier--all for $1.75. Then getting back to downtown Seattle is easy with the 174 bus stop at your door, The ride is just 40 minutes, again for $1.75. Why stay downtown for three, four, or five times the price?

Reviews.Title: “They have good security and basic clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: YVRtoPVR
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend stayed there this past weekend and it was actually OK. They have two security guards patrolling the parking lot and enforcing rules like no guests after 10pm. They don't want this to be a cheap party motel by any means. You don't need a credit card to check in so it's understandable they don't want you trashing their $50 a night rooms with no way of paying for repairs and damage. Very quiet, clean, basic and safe.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly suitable budget motel.”
Reviews.Author: summafunmum
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults, 2 children) stayed at this Motel 6 for one night March 18, 2008 as we had an early flight to Disneyland the next morning. We just wanted a cheap, clean place to sleep as we were leaving at 6 a.m. The big bonus was that this motel offered free Park & Fly for the week we were away, just for staying the one night! We left our van parked right outside the motel office which is staffed 24 hrs/day so felt it was safe. The cost for the airport shuttle, which came immediately when we called, was only $8 total for our entire family. As far as the room goes, I had expected a nightmare but it turned out to be just fine: Simple, but clean. It had two queen beds, a TV and the bathroom was spotless. My only complaint would be that they didn't provide shampoo, only soap. No biggie. But, by far, the main reason we would recommend this motel is for the great deal on Park &Fly and the cheap, convenient shuttle service. (By the way, the shuttle is provided by Extra Car which has their office right next to the motel--hence the quick pick-up. Their service was friendly and professional.) We would have no problem staying at this Motel 6 again.

Reviews.Title: “You are better off sleeping in your car”
Reviews.Author: londonwpr
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Seattle area and since we were flying out early in the morning, we thought we'd save money and stay at Motel 6 Seattle Airport. This was the biggest mistake we made. Our room was a health hazzard. There were blood stains in the bathroom and we found a drug syringe in the roll of the toilet paper. I complained to the hotel manager and she didn't even apologize. You're better off sleeping in your car.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Seattle Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 16500 Pacific Hwy S, Seattle, WA 98188
